com.azure.messaging.eventhubs

Class EventHubClientBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.azure.messaging.eventhubs.EventHubClientBuilder

  • public class EventHubClientBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a fluent builder API to help aid the configuration and instantiation of the EventHubAsyncClient. Calling EventHubClientBuilder.buildAsyncClient() constructs an instant of the client.

    The client requires credentials or a connection string to perform operations against Azure Event Hubs. Setting credentials by using EventHubClientBuilder.connectionString(String), EventHubClientBuilder.connectionString(String, String), or EventHubClientBuilder.credential(String, String, TokenCredential), is required in order to construct an EventHubAsyncClient.

    Creating an EventHubAsyncClient using Event Hubs namespace connection string

    String connectionString = "Endpoint={endpoint};SharedAccessKeyName={sharedAccessKeyName};"
    + "SharedAccessKey={sharedAccessKey};EntityPath={eventHubPath}";
String eventHubPath = "my-event-hub";

EventHubAsyncClient client = new EventHubClientBuilder()
    .connectionString(connectionString, eventHubPath)
    .buildAsyncClient();

    Creating an EventHubAsyncClient using Event Hub instance connection string

    String connectionString = "Endpoint={endpoint};SharedAccessKeyName={sharedAccessKeyName};"
    + "SharedAccessKey={sharedAccessKey};EntityPath={eventHubPath}";

EventHubAsyncClient client = new EventHubClientBuilder()
    .connectionString(connectionString)
    .buildAsyncClient();

    Creating an EventHubAsyncClient using Event Hub with no Retry, different timeout and new Scheduler

    String connectionString = "Endpoint={endpoint};SharedAccessKeyName={sharedAccessKeyName};"
    + "SharedAccessKey={sharedAccessKey};EntityPath={eventHubPath}";

EventHubAsyncClient client = new EventHubClientBuilder()
    .connectionString(connectionString)
    .retry(Retry.getNoRetry())
    .timeout(Duration.ofSeconds(30))
    .scheduler(Schedulers.newElastic("dedicated-event-hub-scheduler"))
    .buildAsyncClient();
    See Also:
    EventHubAsyncClient

    • Method Detail

      • connectionString

        public EventHubClientBuilder connectionString(java.lang.String connectionString)
        Sets the credential information given a connection string to the Event Hub instance.

        If the connection string is copied from the Event Hubs namespace, it will likely not contain the path to the desired Event Hub, which is needed. In this case, the path can be added manually by adding "EntityPath=EVENT_HUB_NAME" to the end of the connection string. For example, "EntityPath=telemetry-hub".

        If you have defined a shared access policy directly on the Event Hub itself, then copying the connection string from that Event Hub will result in a connection string that contains the path.

        Parameters:
        connectionString - The connection string to use for connecting to the Event Hub instance. It is expected that the Event Hub path and the shared access key properties are contained in this connection string.
        Returns:
        The updated EventHubClientBuilder object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if connectionString is null or empty. Or, the connectionString does not contain the "EntityPath" key, which is the name of the Event Hub instance.
        AzureException - If the shared access signature token credential could not be created using the connection string.

      • connectionString

        public EventHubClientBuilder connectionString(java.lang.String connectionString,
                                              java.lang.String eventHubPath)
        Sets the credential information given a connection string to the Event Hubs namespace and a path to a specific Event Hub instance.
        Parameters:
        connectionString - The connection string to use for connecting to the Event Hubs namespace; it is expected that the shared access key properties are contained in this connection string, but not the Event Hub path.
        eventHubPath - The path of the specific Event Hub to connect the client to.
        Returns:
        The updated EventHubClientBuilder object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if connectionString or eventHubPath is null or empty. Or, if the connectionString contains the Event Hub path.
        AzureException - If the shared access signature token credential could not be created using the connection string.

      • configuration

        public EventHubClientBuilder configuration(Configuration configuration)
        Sets the configuration store that is used during construction of the service client. If not specified, the default configuration store is used to configure the EventHubAsyncClient. Use Configuration.NONE to bypass using configuration settings during construction.
        Parameters:
        configuration - The configuration store used to configure the EventHubAsyncClient.
        Returns:
        The updated EventHubClientBuilder object.

      • credential

        public EventHubClientBuilder credential(java.lang.String host,
                                        java.lang.String eventHubPath,
                                        TokenCredential credential)
        Sets the credential information for which Event Hub instance to connect to, and how to authorize against it.
        Parameters:
        host - The fully qualified host name for the Event Hubs namespace. This is likely to be similar to "{your-namespace}.servicebus.windows.net".
        eventHubPath - The path of the specific Event Hub to connect the client to.
        credential - The token credential to use for authorization. Access controls may be specified by the Event Hubs namespace or the requested Event Hub, depending on Azure configuration.
        Returns:
        The updated EventHubClientBuilder object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if host or eventHubPath is null or empty.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if credentials is null.

      • proxyConfiguration

        public EventHubClientBuilder proxyConfiguration(ProxyConfiguration proxyConfiguration)
        Sets the proxy configuration to use for EventHubAsyncClient. When a proxy is configured, TransportType.AMQP_WEB_SOCKETS must be used for the transport type.
        Parameters:
        proxyConfiguration - The proxy configuration to use.
        Returns:
        The updated EventHubClientBuilder object.

      • scheduler

        public EventHubClientBuilder scheduler(reactor.core.scheduler.Scheduler scheduler)
        Sets the scheduler for operations such as connecting to and receiving or sending data to Event Hubs. If none is specified, an elastic pool is used.
        Parameters:
        scheduler - The scheduler for operations such as connecting to and receiving or sending data to Event Hubs.
        Returns:
        The updated EventHubClientBuilder object.

      • transportType

        public EventHubClientBuilder transportType(TransportType transport)
        Sets the transport type by which all the communication with Azure Event Hubs occurs. Default value is TransportType.AMQP.
        Parameters:
        transport - The transport type to use.
        Returns:
        The updated EventHubClientBuilder object.

      • timeout

        public EventHubClientBuilder timeout(java.time.Duration timeout)
        Sets the default operation timeout for operations performed using EventHubAsyncClient and EventHubConsumer such as starting the communication link with the service and sending messages.
        Parameters:
        timeout - Duration for operation timeout.
        Returns:
        The updated EventHubClientBuilder object.

      • retry

        public EventHubClientBuilder retry(Retry retry)
        Sets the retry policy for EventHubAsyncClient. If not specified, Retry.getDefaultRetry() is used.
        Parameters:
        retry - The retry policy to use.
        Returns:
        The updated EventHubClientBuilder object.

      • buildAsyncClient

        public EventHubAsyncClient buildAsyncClient()
        Creates a new EventHubAsyncClient based on options set on this builder. Every time buildAsyncClient() is invoked, a new instance of EventHubAsyncClient is created.

        The following options are used if ones are not specified in the builder:

        • If no configuration is specified, the global configuration is used to provide any shared configuration values. The configuration values read are the BaseConfigurations.HTTP_PROXY, ProxyConfiguration.PROXY_USERNAME, and ProxyConfiguration.PROXY_PASSWORD.
        • If no retry is specified, the default retry is used.
        • If no proxy is specified, the builder checks the global configuration for a configured proxy, then it checks to see if a system proxy is configured.
        • If no timeout is specified, a timeout of one minute is used.
        • If no scheduler is specified, an elastic scheduler is used.
        Returns:
        A new EventHubAsyncClient instance with all the configured options.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the credentials have not been set using either EventHubClientBuilder.connectionString(String) or EventHubClientBuilder.credential(String, String, TokenCredential). Or, if a proxy is specified but the transport type is not web sockets.
